adjective.description: Promiscuous and unprincipled in sexual matters.
examples: the ruler's tyrannical and licentious behavior
unlike many of the artists who frequented the Soho scene of the 1960s, he did not lead a licentious life

adjective.description: Disregarding accepted rules or conventions, especially in grammar or literary style.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin licentiosus, from licentia freedom.
